11322.content: What if the titular girls from the show swapped heads with the other females of Townsville?
11322.title: The Powerpuff Girls

113221.content:
Our three heroines were horsing around in their room. Buttercup started it, sure, but she quickly dragged her sisters into playful fighting...and once again, the toughest fighter wouldn't know her own strength. With an uppercut to Blossom, Buttercup managed to knock her head off!

"Oww! Not so rough Buttercup," The redhead complained, head laying on the ground. Buttercup stood in disbelief seeing her like this. "Aaah!! What did you do to me?!"

"Y-you're okay?!" Buttercup exclaimed. "I'm so sorry Bloss, I had no idea you could do something like that!"

"Me neither," Blossom said as she rolled her eyes.

Bubbles picked up her head. "It should pop back on just like a doll, right?" she inquired. Her sisters sighed at her naivete, but to their further amazement--she was right. Blossom's head snapped back on, completely secure on her body.

"Well that was weird," Blossom stated.

"Hey, see if you can do it again!" Buttercup shouted. "I wanna take my head off too!"

"Now girls, let's not capitalize on a freak accident," Blossom talked down to them. "We should first figure out the scape of this new ability, and--HEY!" Blossom's lecture was interrupted by Buttercup detaching her head.

"Sweet! Imagine all the things we can try by separating our heads," Buttercup said, holding Blossom's head towards her own. That's when Bubbles snatched up Buttercup's head, taking it off her bod as well. "Cool! I got this power too!"

"Looks like it," Bubbles grinned. "If we can do this with other people...just imagine the bodies we can try out!"

This gives Buttercup a mischievous idea. "I say we perform a few body exchanges of our own, just to see what it's like being other people."

Blossom asks, "Who were you thinking?"
113221.title: Swap away!

choices: Bubbles and Buttercup deserve women's bodies too
1132211.content:
And so the trio of heroines flew to the house of Townsville's most renowned secretary, Ms. Bellum. With their newfound power of removing heads, the girls wanted to try being grown up. Knocking on her door, they were quickly welcomed inside.

"What can I do for you girls today?" Ms. Bellum asks. The girls look at each other, curious whether or not to reveal their intentions.

"Hey Ms. Bellum, what's it like being a lady?" Bubbles asks very straightly.

"Well, Bubbles, appearance means a lot. High heels, revealing dresses, and manicured hands are the most ladylike you can get," the woman responded.

"I wanna hear more!" Buttercup added. "Tell me how to kick butt while looking pretty!"

As Ms. Bellum focused on her conversation, Blossom crept behind her. The red Powerpuff concentrated on removing the heads of herself and the curvy woman in front of her. She closed her eyes, hoping to activate her power...and felt it kicking in when her orientation changed.Blossom was about to pop off her head until she noticed the supple cleavage that was now hers--she telepathically switched heads with Ms. Bellum without lifting a hand!

Bubbles and Buttercup's eyes lit up when they saw their sister piloting this woman body. Ms. Bellum, however, must've been "programmed" to be unaware, as she continued her advice to the girls. "You two could learn a thing or two from Blossom. Perfect outfit, perfect shape...I can't help but wish I was you."

Blossom chuckled at that irony. "Thanks for the compliments, Ms. Bellum. I'll catch my sisters up to speed for sure! Thanks for all the advice!" And with that, Blossom strutted out of Ms. Bellum's house, Bubb;es and Buttercup following behind and grinning. They managed to swing a new body already and the original owner was none the wiser.
1132211.title: Head to Ms. Bellum's place

11322111.content:
On their way home, Blossom (now sporting Ms. Bellum's body), Bubbles, and Buttercup stop by the scene of a bank robbery. Their first instinct was to apprehend whoever was responsible...until they saw who it was. Femme Fatale and Sedusa had teamed up for this heist, leaving the bank just as the girls approached it, and it clicked in their minds.

"Bubbles, Buttercup, I think we found your bodies," Blossom said with a hand on her hip.

"We can take their bodies even though they're supervillains?" Bubbles asked of her sister.

"I don't see why not. Dibs on Sedusa!" Buttercup floated towards the evil duo, ready for confrontation. Blossom smirked as she saw her sister and Sedusa's heads glow, and seconds later they were transplanted onto each other's bodies.

"You ready for a fight?" Buttercup teased the old owner of her new body.

"Bring it on, you silly brat!" Sedusa exclaimed. Everyone watched for a moment, and it was revealed that...
11322111.title: Bubbles and Buttercup deserve women's bodie...

113221112.content:
"Alright, sister! Punch me as hard as you can!" Buttercup teased Sedusa, atop each other's bodies.

This earned a growl from the villainess, who finally swung at the green Powerpuff. To the girls' surprise however, Sedusa lacked super strength despite the body she was on! She kicked and punched Buttercup's (formerly her) curvy legs, barely able to move her enemy. Buttercup smirked, squatting down to see Sedusa at her new eye level. "What'd I tell ya?" She said, "You'll never win against the Powerpuff Girls!"

"No fair!" Sedusa whined, stomping her feet. "Femme Fatale, do something!!"

Sedusa's accomplice held a fighting stance against Blossom and Bubbles. The latter saw her chance to claim a lady's body, and concentrated on switching like her sisters did. Femme Fatale swung her foot to kick Bubbles, but in an instant it became Bubbles who kicked Femme Fatale. The villainess was knocked back in her depowered child body, groaning as she hit the floor.

"Now then, are you gonna concede easily?" Blossom asked of the two. Femme Fatale and Sedusa were practically beaten at this point, reduced to the bodies and strength of children.

"So is it the slammer for these two?" asked Buttercup.

Bubbles thought it over too. "I don't know, girls...can we trust them with our bodies? They're supervillains after all...."
113221112.title: Sedusa DOESN'T have Buttercup's powers

choices: They make all three swapped women aware they've been swapped
1132211122.content:
"Girls, I say we take them in," Blossom stated. "Headswapping might've neutralized our powers, but it's a great way to stop crime. And we can't just leave these two as kids! Same with Ms. Bellum. We could pretend being a family in our reversed roles!"

"Ooooh, being a mom sounds like fun!" Bubbles giggles. "Do we get to treat them like our kids then?"

"I would," Buttercup chimes in. "we'll get to tease them for the bodies we stole."

"Then it's settled," Blossom says as she struts over to where Femme Fatale and Sedusa are laying. Bubbles and Buttercup follow her, picking up the one they swapped with, and have each sit on their shoulders.

"Hey! Where are you taking us?!" Femme Fatale demanded to know.

"Oh you two. You'll only learn to be good little girls if we help raise you!" Blossom said eagerly.

"Wait, what?!" Sedusa asked.

"That's right," Buttercup replied, looking up. "You'll never need to steal again, because we'll provide for you from now on! Anything you could possibly spoil yourself with, we'll provide for you."

This had to be a joke. There was no way either of them would get off so easy for robbing a bank!

"What's wrong? You still don't believe us?" Bubbles inquired. "No need to worry, your new mommies will fill you in once we get back home!" The Powerpuffs, sporting their new bodies, took two of their reciprocals back to Ms. Bellum's house.
1132211122.title: Blossom has a different idea...

choices: A trio of fathers to go with their new moms
Superpowers to fly around and stuff!
11322111222.content:
Blossom, Bubbles, and Buttercup escorted the former women to Ms. Bellum's house, where they planned to arrange a new lifestyle for them all. With another knock on her door, Ms. Bellum greeted them once again.

"Girls! What brings you back so soon?" the woman, atop Blossom's old body, asked.

"I helped my sisters with their makeovers," Blossom proudly stated. "All like you said. Dresses, shoes, and jewelry."

"I can see that," she nodded. "but what did you bring those villains here for?"

"They're taking us in as their kids now, apparently," Femme Fatale groaned.

"You know what the best part is, Ms. Bellum?" Bubbles giggled.

"What...?"

"You're gonna be our daughter, too!" Buttercup grinned.

"How...how does that even work?" Ms. Bellum looked at the girls in confusion.

Blossom stepped forward and leaned in. "Ms, Bellum, maybe it hasn't occurred to you, but...How can you live by yourself if you're just a little girl?"

"I don't know...Why do you care all of a sudden?"

"Because all girls need a strong, supporting mother. Someone like...me!" Blossom smiles even more. "And maybe I'll help you look as sexy and beautiful as me." She slaps her rear for emphasis. "So what do you say...Sara? Are we a family or what?"

"Fine, fine! We'll act as a family for now. But I want something in return, mom!"

What does Ms. Bellum want?
11322111222.title: Something else

choices: They return home before thigns get too steamy
113221112221.content:
"If you insist on being my mom, who does that make my dad?" Ms. Bellum asked. She thought it was a clever way to keep the "girls" from getting their way.

Blossom rubbed her chin until an idea went off in her head. "Hey, the Rowdyruff Boys could always make for good parental counterparts! I know just how to keep them in line." She was also thinking about just whose bodies to give them, provided the right opportunity. "Bubbles, Buttercup, whatsay we take a visit to the Townsville jail? Then we'll show Sara who her new dad is." Her sisters grinned in unison, departing once more into town for more headswapped shenanigans.

The Powerpuffs explained to the police how they planned to rehabilitate the Rowdyruff Boys, asking for their release. They were allowed to visit the Boys in a public area of the jail, among the other inmates. Blossom, Bubbles, and Buttercup scanned around for three particular men...the ones who impersonated them, to be exact. They would probably match perfect with the ladies' bodies the Girls acquired for themselves.

"Found one!" Bubbles announced as she spotted her counterpart. She closed her eyes and focused on him and Boomer...and seconds later, the Rowdyruff's head was atop his body! Buttercup giggled at the sight, yet couldn't wait to bring him home.

Buttercup, meanwhile, searched through the crowds, strutting off her looks. She knew it'd get attention...and when she found her impostor, she used her power to give Butch that grown-up body.

Blossom continued searching for her imitator, assessing all of the faces she encountered. When she found the right man, she wasted no time swapping his head with Brick's.

And thus, the Rowdyruffs, in their new adult bodies, were granted freedom under parole of the Powerpuffs.

"Thanks for freeing us, ladies," Brick said. "Now we can go back to wrecking the city!"

"Nuh-uh! You're coming with us now..." Buttercup gave him sass for not changing his ways. "If you're good, I might let you get some of this..." she says as she gestures to her body.

"Buttercup is right. We freed you so that we could help each other be grown-ups," Blossom clarified. "We all look the part, so why not act it?"

"So what do you want us to do first?" Boomer asked earnestly.

"For starters, anything we say," Bubbles said.

"Yeah! Go smack Blossom's butt," Buttercup tells him. Naive as ever, Boomer actually swings his hand and slaps Blossom on her perky ass.

Blushing intensely, Blossom can only think about getting back at her sisters. "Brick, shove your crotch in Buttercup's face!"

"No need," Buttercup said as she was already cupping the red Rowdyruff's package. "Butch, put your face into Bubbles' cleavage!"

Bubbles didn't even resist this request as it happened to her, and all three looked at each other anticipating what might come next.
113221112221.title: A trio of fathers to go with their new moms

1151121.title: Rarity

11511212.content:
Today had been a good day for Rarity. She had spent most of her day with Spike, scavenging for gems and other trinkets, in order to pretty up her newest clients dress.

"Wow Rarity! you hit the jackpot this time!" Spike exclaimed, marvelling at the cart full of delicious gems Rarity was pulling.

"I believe you mean "We" Spikey wikey." The elegant unicorn exclaimed as she flipped her mane.

"After all, I couldn't have done all of this without the help of my cute little assistant!" Rarity said as she looked over at the blushing baby dragon.

"Aw shucks, you don't have to thank me Rarity. You know i'd do anything f- " Spike's sentence was cut short as he and Rarity noticed something odd in front of them.

Lying on the ground just ahead of the pair was...
11511212.title: She finds a magical artifact.

choices: That her and Spike's heads were on the ground.
That she and Spike had swapped heads.
115112121.content:
"How strange. I wonder how a sword came to be lost near a peaceful place like Ponyville?" Said Rarity, as she trotted over for a closer look.

"Hey look Rarity!" Spike pointed. "There's a note attached to it."

"Hmm, let's see here..." "Rarity said as she began to read it.

"To the pony that finds this note, know that this is no ordinary sword. What you see before you is the Sword of Peace. A Legendary artifact, dating back to the time of the three tribes. This blade can do no harm. Even if you were to slice somepony's head clean off. Both their body and head would be completely unharmed. As the former owner of this weapon, I now pass it on to you."

The dragon and unicorn pair paused and looked at each other.

"Whoever wrote this must be totally nuts." Spike said, an unamused expression on his face.

"Indeed." Rarity exclaimed as she lifted up the blade with her magic.

"I for one have never heard of any magic that can- AHH!" Rarity was cut off as she tripped her front hoof on a stone. Causing her to fall on top of Spike.

Before Spike could even let out a yell, the blade Rarity had been holding fell directly onto both of their necks.

"Ooh, my beautiful head" Said Rarity as she squinted her eyes in pain.

Rarity was about to ask if Spike was unharmed. However, when she opened eyes she was surprised to see...
115112121.title: A magic sword.

choices: In shock. (He is aware of the swap).
In relief that Rarity is ok. (He is unaware and thinks they were always this way
1151121212.content:
Rarity blinked in confusion. Unable to comprehend what she was seeing. Lying in front of her was a mare, who's body looked very familiar to her. But attached to the mare's neck was the head of a small purple dragon!

"Spike! Wh- wh- what is happening!?" Rarity stammered as she raised her manicured white hoof to point at-. Rarity paused. The appendage she was pointing wasn't manicured, white and it definitely was not a hoof! Instead what she saw, was a small scaly purple claw.

Fearing the worst. Rarity looked down at herself to confirm what she had assumed. below her head, was the body of a small and slightly chubby baby dragon.

"AHHHH!" Rarity screamed!

"W- WHAT IS IT RARITY!? ARE YOU HURT!? Spike, who had only just opened his eyes yelled in concern.

Spike then saw the freakish image that lay in front of him. The love of his life's head was now attached to his own body!

Spike reacts...
1151121212.title: That she and Spike had swapped heads.

choices: Resist the urge and go back to Ponyville.
11511212122.content:
"Oh thank Celestia you're okay." Spike said, putting a hoof on his chest and sighing. "I was afraid you'd been hurt by that sword we found."

"Sp-pike!? W-What h-happened to us!? Rarity yelled, stuttering in shock.

Spike tilted his head in confusion. "What are you talking about? You look fine to me and I don't feel any different." Spike said, looking himself over.

"Don't feel any different!?" Rarity's shock gave way to utter confusion. How could Spike act like everything was normal at a time like this?

"Spike! Y-You have my body! How can you be so calm after what just happened!?"

"I have your... body? Spike repeated. trying to figure out what Rarity could possibly mean by that. After all. He had looked himself over and all he saw was the same old white furred, four hooved body he had always had. "Is this some kinda prank? Because if it is...I don't get it."

Rarity couldn't bring herself to form another sentence. She simply stared at Spike as though he had grown a second head... Although growing another head would have been a lot less strange then the situation she had found herself in.

"Umm, so anyway..." Spike awkwardly rubbed the back of his head with Rarity's hoof. "It's getting a little late, so I should really get back to Ponyville with the gems we've collected." Spike began hooking his pony body up to the cart of gems they had gathered earlier. "See you tomorrow Rarity!"

Rarity watched as Spike with her own body below his head, began trotting off back to town.

Rarity's mind was buzzing with questions. Why had she and Spike swapped heads!? 'How' had they swapped heads!? Why did Spike act as though nothing had happened!? What was-? Rarity paused as she caught sight of the sword lying on the ground in front of her. She reached out with her new scaly appendage and awkwardly gripped it. Not used to suddenly having claws instead of hooves.

"This sword... The note wasn't lying. It actually works." Rarity whispered to herself. "Is this also why Spike was acting as though we had always been this way?... What kind of strange magic is this?" Rarity wondered aloud.

Rarity began slowly wiggling her new claws in front of herself. "This feels so... Different."

She tried to take a step forward, only to fall flat on her face. She let out a small cry of pain, then looked back at Spike's lower half. "Ah yes 'Two' legs. I forgot about that..."

She carefully pushed herself back on to Spike's feet. "I should get back to town and find a way to reverse this." She looked down at the small 'Male' dragon body below her head. "Or perhaps... No. I couldn't. Twilight would kill me if I do... On the other hoof... She doesn't need to know."

Does Rarity.

11533211.content:
One day, Ruby found what appears to be a case of dust from Weiss' collection. She could not resist in looking at it or poking it as she was so curious.

"Wow! I never seen this kind of dust before!" Ruby said, "Maybe a little poke wouldn't hurt."

Ruby proceeds to poke the dust only for some of it to reach her nose. The huntress begin to sneeze as she felt an odd sensation on her neck.

"Geez! At least none of it spilled," Ruby hoped.

The huntress was about to leave only for one problem. She couldn't really move and in fact, she lost all feeling from the neck down. Ruby looked below herself only to find out that her head is floating above her body.

"Oh no! I'm a floating head! All those years of working out with my body is now wasted!" Ruby cried as her head is suddenly moving on her own, "I'm not doing this!"

So Ruby's head ended up flying about to who knows where as she cried for help. No one really saw her and at best thought that she was messing around. Ruby's head eventually flew past someone and she collided with said person.

"Oh, what happened?" Ruby said as she looks down and realized she has a body again, "Sweet! I'm not a floating head! But... this isn't right."

As it turns out, Ruby has the body of...
11533211.title: Ruby Rose

Ruby went around to look for the original Weiss. Assuming that Weiss is at the same place Ruby's original body was at before swapping heads. Ruby went back to the bedroom and found out that...

11533211112.title: Weiss's head on Ruby's body and not aware

11533213.content: On to the next two...
11533213.title: more...

115332131.content:
Team RWBY was in a slump. The latest lead they had been following, about a cache of “magical artifacts” that Ozpin had seemed very insistent might be somehow useful (even though he didn’t actually know what was there any more than they did), had turned out to be a dud. Well, probably. There had been a few items there that they hadn’t been able to identify yet – they didn’t seem like they’d be anything useful, but currently Ozpin (or Oz, or Oscar, or whoever he was now) was away with Jaune and the others and until he got back to confirm their assessment they couldn’t get rid of any of it, or indeed do much of anything else. Thus it was that the four girls were lounging in a room of their current safe house, trying to think of ways to stay occupied and running low on options. Blake Belladonna had all this on her mind as she sat in what she had deemed to be the most comfortable chair and stared at the object in her lap. It had been found along with the ‘artifacts’ and, despite clearly lacking any magical significance, was ironically the only one that she thought might possibly turn out to be interesting.

It was a book, a dusty old one. On the worn-looking front cover (it had no dust jacket) were the words, Wondrous Tales to Thrill and Inspire. No author was listed. It had been idle curiosity that had originally drawn her to the book, but something to read was something to read, and Blake felt reasonably confident that she could distract herself from the boredom of their current situation for a few hours at the absolute least. She opened the book and was greeted by the smell of an entire library. Blake smiled to herself. She didn’t really think of herself as a ‘book nerd’, but there was no denying that she found a special little pleasure in the smell of old books. She looked down at the first page, a table of contents. It seemed that this was an anthology of short stories, seemingly drawn from a variety of genres. She read:

- The Saga of the Stars
- Tales of the Old Frontier
- Romance of the Knight and Princess
- The Lives of the Jungle Beasts

…among others. She paused for a moment, deliberating on which story she felt most like starting right now.
115332131.title: Blake Belladonna

1153321311.content:
Blake opens the book as she was curious about said story. It appears to have her taste of literature based on an image as she turned the page to said story. But suddenly, her vision went blank as if someone shined a light at her face. When Blake's vision cleared up, she found herself in what appeared to be a spaceship of sorts. More like a base similar to the one in Star Trek.

Blake saw that she has a new outfit, a jumpsuit of sort while having a more sci-fi version of her katana gun. She then notices something odd about her body when she pokes at it a bit.

"Going into another world is one thing, but something is not right," Blake said to herself.

The huntress found a zipper of sorts in her outfit as she decided to take a peak at what's under. Upon unzipping, she realized that there is something wrong with her body. It clearly did not belong to her as she looked in a mirror. Her head looks normal but it seriously contrasted with her body. As it turns out, her body...
1153321311.title: Spaceships

choices: A busty women with a different skin color
11533213112.content:
Her new body was covered in fur, but it at least matches with her hair color. Blake notices that her face was slightly more cat like, but there isn't much of a difference. She is aware that there are Faunus like her that have more fur than others, but this was something she was not used to.

"It's okay Blake, it could be worse! I could ended up with a guy's body," Blake said to herself, "This feels like some head swapping fic."

Blake look at other things that were equipped with her jumpsuit. One of which is her id of sorts that looks as if her face was photoshopped on it. The other things were keys, a communicator of sorts, and other odd gadgets.

The Faunus also notices that the ship looked empty. At worst, a bit deserted and dirty. The room that she's in is a mess with some equipment either broken or have stains on them.

"The Sage of the Stars," Blake said, "According to the summary that I barely read, the story is about a heroine stuck in an abandoned ship in the middle of a Saga of Stars... odd way of incorporating the title I suppose."

Blake is normally used to being alone, but she grew concerned about her friends at the moment. She decided that it is best to act like the heroine in the story to the best of her ability and get out of it.

As Blake went on, she saw the halls having light flickering with some slime here and there. She assumed that whatever caused the ship to become deserted must have caused this. As she went on, she spotted what appears to be another living person on board. This person appears to have long familiar blond hair which gave Blake some hope.

"Yang!" Blake called.

The figured turned around and it was Yang, "Blake! There you are!"

1153321312.content:
Hmmm…maybe I feel like a cowboy story?

The last thing Blake remembered was turning the page. Then, blackness.

Blake awoke suddenly, with a gasp. Had she been sleeping? How long had she been out? Last thing I remember was turning the page in that book… that thought was immediately shelved for visitation at a later date as Blake became aware of three things in rapid succession. One: She was in a bed. She had not been in a bed when she’d blacked out. Two: She did not recognize her surroundings. She seemed to be in someone’s bedroom, with wooden walls all around and heavy wooden beams on the ceiling. And ‘C’: She was not alone. She was, in fact, sharing the rather large bed with two other women she was sure she’d never seen before, one on each side of her, both still apparently asleep. Blake glanced around dazedly, her quick assessment of her surroundings having done nothing to dispel her confusion and quite a bit to exacerbate it. Should she wake the two strange women up? Maybe they could tell her what was happening. She sat up, the sheets falling off her body, and instantly added two new problems to her list. First off, she was naked. While normally waking up unexpectedly naked – coupled with the unfamiliar surroundings – would easily take first priority in terms of ‘things to be concerned about’, in this case it was easily eclipsed by the second thing: this body was not hers.

“Wha…? H-how…HUH?” She bleated helplessly, unable to contain herself in her shock. This body, which could not be hers but somehow was, was muscular, well-tanned and unmistakably male. She looked down at her newly flat chest – well, maybe ‘flat’ wasn’t exactly the right word, those pecs were amazing – and further to her exquisitely sculpted abs. There was little body hair in evidence, but her skin looked rough and more than one scar was noticeable even at a glance. Honestly, it was a body she might have responded to, if she weren’t currently using it. Blake paused. Below the abs, below the navel, the sheets were still covering… she had to see it. She lifted the sheet delicately. “Hoooly shit,” she said. Not normally the swearing type, but if you couldn’t bust out some profanity at a time like this, then what was even the point?

Just then...
1153321312.title: Cowboys

11533213121.content:
“Somethin’ the matter, honey?” Blake froze. For a second she’d forgotten about the other two women in the room. She turned to see one of them (the one on her left) looking at her.

“Uhh…no. No, nothing’s wrong…um.” The woman’s expression was quizzical. “Can. Can I ask you something?” Blake felt herself stumbling over the words as she said them. “Where, exactly, am I?”

The woman looked confused. “Don’t you recognize your own room? You’ve been stayin’ here a whole two weeks now.”

“My room?”

“Yeah, your room. At the inn?” The woman sat up next to Blake, prompting a loud snore from the woman on the right who was still asleep. “You sure there ain’t nothin’ the matter?”

As the woman sat up, the sheets fell away from her body as well and Blake could see that she, too, was completely nude. Blake was pretty sure she knew what had been going on last night, and it was a pretty safe bet that the other woman was naked as well. They were actually both quite beautiful, although their hair was disheveled and their makeup rubbed off. The woman she was currently talking to had dark brown hair (the other one was blonde), archetypal ‘doe eyes’, and a particularly cute nose (if Blake were to say so). Blake had to admit that she’d felt attraction to other girls before, but she’d never actually seen another woman naked and so close (except for that one time she’d walked in on Weiss getting into the shower). Yet here this one was, staring right at her, smooth skin and round, firm breasts on full display. Blake felt something happening between her legs. It was a sensation she’d never felt before, but she knew exactly what it was. Oh, dear, she said inside her head, and was grateful she’d had the restraint not to say it out loud.

“Excuse me for just a second,” Blake said. She rose from the bed and stumbled across the room, trying as hard as she could not to think about the extra weight from the semi-erect thing between her legs.

“Where are you goin’?” asked the brunette whose name Blake hadn’t even learned (and she could see now that the blonde was waking up as well).

“Bathroom!”

“Wrong way, sugar.” The brunette pointed to a door on the other side of the room. “C’mon now, the whiskey wasn’t THAT strong.”

Blake crossed the room (stepping perhaps a bit more gingerly than was strictly necessary) and slipped through the door. The room on the other side was small but well lit from a window high in the wall. Blake saw a bathtub, some towels, and a curious piece of furniture she recognized as an old-fashioned washbasin. No toilet was in evidence. “Well I guess it is a BATH-room,” Blake muttered to herself, “and not a toilet room…still weird that they don’t even have a sink, though. Does this place even have plumbing?” Ultimately, though, it wasn’t the plumbing fixtures (or lack thereof) that drew her attention, but the full-length mirror in the corner. Staring back at her from the mirror was a very rugged-looking naked man, well-muscled but not beefy, with a fine coating of body hair and a few interesting scars. But rising from the shoulders was Blake’s own very female head. Dumbfounded, she leaned in a little closer, running her new meaty man-fingers through her familiar sleek black hair. Her face was clearly a few tones lighter than the rest of her body, but it blended gradually down the neck (smooth, with no Adam’s-apple) into the tan skin of her body. She looked up to her two cat ears and twitched them experimentally. “Well,” she said quietly, “I guess that’s why my voice still sounds the same.” She examined her new body some more, gazing over her hairy arms and running her hands over her new chest. Were my old shoulders quite this bony? I wonder where these scars came from… one thing she was absolutely NOT going to look at was the pen- uhh, the thing down there. It was not necessary. There was no need to acknowledge it. She didn’t have to pee, and it was completely irrelevant that there were two beautiful, naked women on the other side of that door oh no there it goes again THINK OF SOMETHING ELSE! Blake took a few seconds to collect herself until she was ready to speak.

“Um…do either of you know where my clothes are?”
11533213121.title: The women start to wake up.

choices: Yang is a man now, too.
115332131211.content:
Several minutes later, once all parties were suitably dressed, Blake and the girls (their names were Barbara and Erin) ventured forth from the room. Blake’s jaw had almost dropped when she first saw her clothes. A long duster, high boots, and pants that looked like they were designed for riding on horseback. More different kinds of leather than she believed she’d ever seen in a single outfit. And the finishing touch: a wide-brimmed hat with what seemed to be a snakeskin hatband sitting on a nearby chair. “What am I, a cowboy?” Blake muttered – fortunately, quiet enough that the women didn’t hear. Blake had been careful not to try to get more information from her female companions, lest she create more confusion. It hadn’t even occurred to her to try to explain her situation (as she understood it) honestly; surely they would ship her off to the looney bin. She would try to get more info from other people she might encounter, but she would have to be careful about it.

She looked around her; they had stepped out into a very bare and very dim hallway lit only by some candles in wall sconces. Sheesh, this place is old-fashioned, she thought. Something stirred in the back of her mind; she’d first felt it when she’d seen her clothes but she still couldn’t quite identify the sensation. Well, maybe she could: it was the sensation of having forgotten something. But what had she forgotten? The hall opened up into a large common room, and all around were people chatting, drinking, and generally having a great time. Every one of them was dressed to match Blake’s new outfit – here were more men in dusty leather and cowboy hats, there were women in fancy ruffled dresses, there was even a man with suspenders and a handlebar mustache. Over it all was the sound of jaunty piano music that she had somehow failed to notice until just now. The overall tableau looked like – no, could only possibly be – a scene from…

“A frontier flick,” Blake whispered, as she realized what her subconscious had been trying to tell her. (NOTE: I am specifically avoiding the word "Western" because, while I'm confident Remnant had cowboys at one point, I don't know enough about fantasy geography to say whether they were West of anything.) She was well aware of the well-established genre of films wherein cowboys and bandits clashed along the unsettled frontier of the olden days. She hadn’t been all that much a fan, per se, but the clichés were well embedded in the public consciousness. And hadn’t it been just such a story (albeit in a written form) that she had idly intended to start reading the literal second she’d blacked out and woken up here?

Blake rubbed the bridge of her nose. This was a lot to process. But unless she’d spontaneously passed out and was having an exceptionally realistic dream, it all fit together. It didn’t make a single damn bit of sense, but it clicked.

“Girls,” Blake said slowly, already wincing in anticipation of the awkwardness that was about to ensue, “this is going to sound really stupid but… where, exactly, are we right now?”

Both of the ladies looked at her, looked at each other, and burst into laughter. But as Blake was calculating how to phrase her next words in the least suspicious way possible, a man approached her.

“Mr. Belladonna? Sir?” It took Blake a second to remember that she was apparently a man now, and also to process that he had used her actual surname despite her having seemingly stepped into the life of a completely different person. Come to think of it, she realized, I don’t know who I’m supposed to be right now at all.

“What did you call me?” Blake asked the man. He was certainly a different sort than the grizzled-looking men filling the rest of the room. He was small, skinny, and nervous-looking. Despite a complete lack of evidence, Blake instinctively pegged him as some kind of servant or stable hand. He hesitantly spoke again.

“Sorry, isn’t your name Blake Belladonna?” Hmm. So I still have my name as well as my face. Interesting.

“…Yeah,” said Blake, realizing that perhaps she was coming off a little too confrontationally and relaxing just a little.

“Well…came in to tell ya Yang’s outside waitin’ for ya, ‘sall.” The man nervously shuffled away.

“Yang??” Blake couldn’t believe it. Was Yang here with her? Had she been drawn into this…place by that book, too? “Where?” She called after the disappearing messenger.
“’Round back!” Came the shouted reply. A hand rose above the crowd that had already swallowed him, finger pointing behind her. “That way!”

Blake mumbled an apology to Erin and Barbara and dashed off to meet her friend. Locating the correct door took a few tries, but eventually she stumbled out into the sun of a dusty lot behind the building. She was blinking to get her bearings when she heard a familiar voice.
115332131211.title: option 1

choices: The return of the stablehand girl.
1153321312113.content:
“Blake! There you are!” Blake whipped around, scanning her surroundings. The only other being she could see nearby was a horse. It was a good-looking horse, with a lustrous tan-and-white coat and a long, blonde tail swishing behind it. And at the end of its neck was the head of Blake’s friend, Yang Xiao Long.

“OK, so don’t freak out,” Yang said.

Blake did not quite hear this, as she was busy freaking out. “GAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHFUCK!!! Holy Fucking….fuck! Yang! You’re a HORSE???”

“Yeah,” Yang said, a bit sheepishly (horseishly?), “Guess I wasn’t as lucky as you. Nice outfit, by the way.”

“Uh, thanks,” Blake replied, looking down at herself, “but I have the wrong body too.” She opened her shirt to show her new chest. “See? I’m a guy now…as are you, I see.”

“Huh?” Said Yang. “Wait, really?” Blake realized that the new position of her friend’s head likely made it impossible to see most of her own current body. “Dang, I thought those felt like balls hanging down there! …What do they look like?”

“Do we need to have this discussion right now?” Snapped Blake. “There are clearly much more important questions right now! Do you know where we are, or how we got here?”

“Well, I don’t know where we are, but I think I know how we got here. It was that weird book! You opened it and then we all got…sucked inside!”

“Yeah, that was my theory too,” said Blake. “Do you think Ruby and Weiss are here somewhere, too?”

Both of them were abruptly startled by another woman’s voice. “Y’all ready to get tacked up?” A pretty young woman in a checkered shirt and very dirty pants was striding jauntily towards them. She had short red hair, and the pair of light brown desert fox ears on top of her head marked her as a faunus.

“Tacked…up?” Blake repeated. She idly wondered whether she still counted as a faunus in this version of reality.
“Tack.” Said Yang. “It means riding gear – like a saddle and stuff.”

“Oh.”

“Well, aren’t you a beautiful horse!” The fox-eared woman said to Yang admiringly. “And what’s your name, handsome?”

“Yang,” said Yang, smiling, “and flattery will get you nowhere.”

“Well, Yang,” said the woman, “I reckon this here fella is awful lucky to have such a fine animal as you.” She gave Yang’s back a rub, while Yang smirked and swished her tail. “Now both of you wait here, I’ll be right back with the saddle.”

“She can understand you?” Asked Blake once the woman was gone.

“Why not? I’m speaking normally, aren’t I? You can understand me.”

“Yes but…you’re supposed to be a horse! And horses aren’t supposed to talk!”

“Yeah, I know what you mean. But I was talking to some stablehands earlier, and they understood me too. The other horses here all look normal, but for some reason nobody seems all that surprised that I can talk…or that I have a human face.”

Blake was gazing at that face now. This was a face she had become very familiar with, the face of the girl who had become her closest friend. She’d had dreams about this face – not that anyone knew about that, of course. There were the same blue eyes, same easy smile. The only concession to her changed species were a pair of horse ears poking up through her blonde hair. Unlike Blake, she didn’t still possess human ears, although that same blonde hair mostly obscured this fact. And behind her lovely locks, a short mane of the same color ran down the horse’s neck.

“What are you staring at?” Yang asked her friend.

“Oh, just… having a hard time accepting all this, that’s all.”

“You and me both! At least you’re still a person.”

“I was thinking you were taking this pretty well, actually.” Blake had been thrown completely through a loop when she’d woken up in a strange place with someone else’s body. But Yang, despite having it even worse (or so Blake thought), was still smiling. That was definitely one of the things Blake liked about her.

“Well… I guess I just thought that I might as well go with it, right? Not like I can do anything about it right now. And on the bright side, I have a full four limbs again! …Although I guess I went from one arm to none…”

Blake almost had to stifle a laugh. It was such an absurd thing to consider in the midst of such a dire situation. But it did feel good – while still very disoriented, with Yang here things seemed more OK.

“You can come closer, you know,” Yang said. “I’m not going to bite you… unless I mistake your finger for a carrot.” She gave a wry smile. “Us horses will do that sometimes.”

Blake walked over to her friend’s side. This was all too weird. Still, she definitely didn’t want Yang to think she was uncomfortable around her. If anything Yang was her primary source of comfort at the moment. She put her hand up, hesitating only a little, and placed it on Yang’s light brown flank. It was so smooth and warm. This was actually her first time touching a horse, come to think of it. She began stroking the short fur gently, a bit too overwhelmed by the moment to consider that she was petting her friend like an animal. Not that Yang minded. In fact, had Blake had a bit more presence of mind just then, she might have noticed her eyes darting away nervously, and a distinct blush creeping into her cheeks.

This moment was ended by...
1153321312113.title: Some of you might've seen this coming

11533213121131.content:
“Alright, think this is everything,” came the voice of the returning Faunus girl, bringing both out of their reverie. She was carrying a heavy-looking saddle and some other, less identifiable pieces, all of which she set atop a nearby horizontal wooden beam. “Couldn’t find a bridle, but I s’pose you ain’t got one, huh? Can’t think of how it’d fit on such an unusual face… oh, but don’t worry,” she said to Yang, “that face is what makes you beautiful.” Here she clapped a friendly hand on Yang’s rump, just above the base of her tail. Yang seemed a bit perturbed but smiled again. “‘Sides,” the woman continued, “not like you really need reins if the two of ya can just talk it over where to go. Wish I had a talking horse, it’d be mighty convenient. Anyways, let’s get you all geared up.”

This process took a bit longer than Blake had expected, mostly because there were actually several pieces of “tack” that needed to go on underneath (and thus before) the saddle itself. “Sorry if this is a bit uncomfortable,” said the woman as she reached under Yang’s body to tighten some straps around her stomach.

“Oh, don’t apologize,” said Yang. “Anything that gets a pretty lady to put her hands all over me is OK in my book!” At this she gave an exaggerated wink.

“Yang, you are a charmer,” said the woman as she adjusted a few more things on the saddle pad. Blake’s eyes narrowed.

Just don’t get a horse boner, she thought.

“Alright,” came the lady’s voice, snapping Blake out of her unpleasant train of thought. “Everything’s ready!” She took a step back from Yang, now adorned with a smart-looking saddle.

“Well, what do you think?” joked the girl-turned-horse. “Does it suit me?” She struck what she clearly intended to be a heroic-looking pose, flicking her tail and tossing her hair at the same time. Not knowing exactly how to respond to that, Blake turned to the Faunus woman instead.

“Thanks so much,” she began, before changing the subject. “But let me ask you something. Do you know anybody named Ruby Rose or Weiss Schnee around here?”
11533213121131.title: The return of the stablehand girl.

115332131211311.content:
The woman looked thoughtful. “Well, I don’t know any Rubies, but Weiss Schnee works at the dance hall across town… She’s somethin’ else, that Schnee woman. Don’t know how you might know her, or what your business might be, but I’d sure be careful if it was me in your shoes.”

Yeah, that sounds about right for Weiss, Blake and Yang both thought at the same time.

Blake smiled at the woman. “Much obliged,” she said, and tossed her a coin (she’d had to do some digging around in her new outfit’s pockets, but now she was reasonably sure what all she had on her person and where, including how much money she was carrying). Then she tipped her hat and turned towards Yang. This cowboy thing could be growing on her, she felt. In a couple more steps she sprang up onto the saddle, with just enough momentum to get her belly over the top before falling backwards onto her ass. Yang’s face involuntarily flushed red.

“Uh… you okay there, mister?” called the Faunus woman.

“No!” replied an embarrassed Blake. “I mean, yes! I just…made a misstep.” She stood back up and stared at the saddle, contemplating the best plan of attack. “How do I get up there?” she hissed at Yang under her breath.

“I don’t know!” Yang hissed back. “I think you just jump! That’s what I did the time I rode a horse!”

“You sure you don’t need any help?” the woman called out again.

“No, I got it!” responded Blake, who most definitely did not have it. Maybe if I put my foot in the stirrup first…no, too high. Let me think… “Yang, are you laughing at me?”

“Trying not to!” Yang giggled.

“Oh!” said the Faunus stablehand suddenly. “Silly me, I never even thought to give you a mounting block!”

“A what?” asked Blake, but the girl was already hurrying off around a corner. Seconds later, though, she was back, carrying a good-sized wooden crate.

“Here,” she said, placing it on the ground next to Blake, alongside Yang.

“Ooohhhhh,” the two friends said in unison.

“Thanks again,” said Blake, and with the crate as a step she was up and seated on the saddle in a second (with a few more seconds to get properly situated). There was a pause as both girls (or rather, former girls) fully realized the position they were now in.

I’m on top of Yang, haha, Blake thought somewhat dreamily. I’ve got her between my legs…

Blake is sitting on my back, thought Yang. She’s riding me…

“Well! Better get going then!” Blake almost shouted.

“You said it!” said Yang, her voice a little bit stilted. A single drop of sweat rolled down her forehead.

Blake, as if by instinct, gently dug her heels into her mount’s sides, and the two of them were off.
115332131211311.title: She does

choices: Weiss demands an explanation for this nonsense.
1153321312113112.content:
If sitting on Yang’s back was awkward standing still, it was worse in motion. Every movement of her horse body seemed to jostle against Blake’s groin and make the saddle creak. She was desperate for another distraction.

“So… you said you’ve ridden horses before?” Blake asked.

“Yeah, just a couple times, when I was younger,” said Yang. “Wouldn’t have called myself a ‘horse girl’ - except now, well…”

Blake didn’t know what to say in response to that. Fortunately for her, Yang had more.

“So, it sounds like Weiss must still be a woman here, huh? Lucky her.”

“Yeah, I guess so,” said Blake, remembering what the stablehand had said. “Glad she isn’t a scorpion or something, at least.”

“You don’t think she’d make a good scorpion?” said Yang. “I think it would suit her.”

“Don’t be mean,” chided Blake, though she was clearly amused.

“I’m not! Scorpions are badass! And I think her head on a scorpion would look cute, too.”

Blake had to laugh at that mental image. She looked at the town passing them by, every bit the picturesque frontier town as seen in every cowboy movie ever. “Hey”, she suddenly said.

“…Yeah?”

“We…don’t actually know where we’re going, do we?”

Fortunately, getting directions wasn’t hard. The place they were looking for, the Snow White Dance Hall, was a huge and ornate structure, a far cry from anything else they’d seen so far. No one familiar was in evidence outside, but there were bright lights and sounds of raucous activity coming from within.

Blake dismounted respectably, if not gracefully. “Wait here,” she told her horse.

“You’re the cowboy,” replied Yang. She watched as Blake went inside.

“Raucous” was definitely the right word to describe what was going on inside. All around was a veritable menagerie of characters, human and faunus, some clean and well-dressed, some dirty and rugged, all talking, drinking, joking, gaming, and generally carousing in every way imaginable. While many looked like cowboys, farmers, or working people from the town, there were also a lot of women with fancy dresses and elaborate hairstyles. Blake expected Weiss to be one of them, but she was nowhere to be seen.

Blake approached a man who seemed to work here. “Excuse me… is Weiss Schnee around?

“Blake Belladonna, as I live and breathe! Didn’t know you were back in town!” Evidently the man knew her (or should she say, knew him?). She probably couldn’t risk fishing info out of him about who she (he?) was supposed to be, though. “Miss Schnee is in back, freshenin’ up – don’t think she’d be all too pleased to see you, though.”

“Let me worry about that,” Blake said with a confidence that may not have been entirely justified. Here was more evidence that Weiss, or at least her ‘incarnation’ in this world, was an unpleasant, possibly dangerous character. And according to this man, she and Blake had apparently had a history? Blake tried to prepare herself for what she might find as she walked down the corridor the man had pointed out… although surely it couldn’t be as much of a shock as waking up with a male body, or seeing Yang as a horse.

Blake nudged the door open and peered inside. There was Weiss, sure enough, touching up her makeup in front of a mirror. She was wearing a white corset and a puffy white skirt, and at first Blake assumed that she still had her true body, but closer inspection said otherwise: the skin of her body was, like Blake’s, distinctly darker in tone than the skin of her face, and her bust – heavily emphasized by her current outfit – was surely a size or two larger than normal. Blake had gotten so caught up in these little details that it took her a second to realize Weiss was looking at her.
1153321312113112.title: Arriving at the dance hall.

choices: Blake reports her discovery to Yang.
11533213121131123.content:
Weiss’s eyes narrowed in a distinctly hostile expression – understandable, Blake figured. Maybe she blames me for getting us into this mess. I am the one who opened the book – assuming that really is the cause, I mean.

“Let me just explain,” said Blake cautiously.

“I don’t want to hear your explanation,” Weiss spat angrily – a little too angrily, Blake thought, given the circumstances – “I made it very clear when we last saw each other that if I ever saw you again you’d be lucky if I didn’t kill you.”

“I…what?” Blake was suddenly very confused. What the hell was Weiss talking about? ‘When we last saw each other?’ Hadn’t they just been together a couple hours ago? And was it her imagination, or had Weiss picked up something of the local accent?

“Don’t act like you don’t understand, you know damn well what you did!” Weiss rose from her seat and pointed angrily at Blake. “You hurt me as badly as I’ve ever been hurt, and if I didn’t have a show to worry about tonight I’d give you a bloody nose right now! Or worse!”

“What…what are you even talking about? I really don’t understand! If you were this angry with me, why didn’t you tell me?”

“Tell you? How was I supposed to do that, when I had no idea where you were for six whole years? You could have been dead for all I knew! Honestly, I wish you had been!

Six years? Hold on, Blake thought, this doesn’t add up. Something’s definitely fishy here…Maybe…

“What do you remember?” she asked.

“Remember?” Weiss looked confused, thrown for a second. But then she was angry again. “Oh, I remember everything! I remember how you told me you weren’t like the others, that you’d stay by me no matter what! And then you betrayed me, and left me here to try to get by all alone! I could never forget, and I’ll certainly never forgive you!”

“How long have you been working here?”

“In this dump? Four years, not that you’d care.”

Hypothesis confirmed. She doesn’t remember reality. Blake had no idea why, but for some reason Weiss was apparently convinced she’d always been an inhabitant of this world of frontier story clichés.

“…Sorry for bothering you,” she said, and closed the door before Weiss could throw any more abuse at her. She had to go report this to Yang. Then the two of them could figure out their next step. Not to mention they still needed to find Ruby…
11533213121131123.title: Weiss recognizes her...sort of.

choices: Check in on Ruby and Weiss for a moment?
115332131211311231.content:
As Blake was lost in thought, a child running down the corridor collided with her at bellybutton level. “Oof! Sorry, mister! Guess I was going a little too fast!” Blake glanced down at the kid and found herself looking straight into the face of Ruby Rose.

“Um, do I know you, mister?” Ruby asked. “You look really familiar.”

Well, I found Ruby, Blake thought. And it looks like she doesn’t remember, either. Like her three teammates, Ruby seemed to have retained her normal head, but it was situated on the body of a young child of indeterminate gender and no more than eight years of age. Blake thought that her head looked just a tad too big for that body, but it was hard to be sure.

“Maybe we do know each other. Do you know Ms. Weiss Schnee, who works here? I was just talking to her.”

“Yeah, mister, that’s my mom!” Ruby beamed. “If you know my mom, maybe we saw each other before, and that’s how I know you!”

Blake was trying to process what she’d just been told. “Yes,” she said hesitantly, “that must be it. I’m Blake, by the way.”

“Hi Blake! My name’s Ruby!”

“Ruby…Schnee?”

“No, silly! Ruby Rose!”

“Right.”

“Anyways,” Ruby said, “I have to go. It was nice meeting you Mr. Blake!”

Blake stood stone-still as Ruby ran off. Well, I admit it, she thought, after seeing Yang’s face on a horse I thought I was ready for anything, but that definitely threw me through a loop. “I wonder what Yang will say,” she said, to no one in particular.
115332131211311231.title: Blake immediately finds Ruby.

choices: Let's see some other story options.
1153321313.content: Romance of the Knight and Princess, you can probably guess what that's about. The Lives of the Jungle Beasts is sort of a Jungle Book-meets-Aesop's Fables sort of thing. Do either of those sound appealing? Because there are other stories to choose from...
1153321313.title: the other two

choices: Blake finds herself with an animal's body.
11533213132.content:
"The Lives of The Jungle Beasts?" came a voice from behind, and Blake turned to find Ruby peering over her shoulder. Normally Blake took a decidedly dim view of people trying to read over her shoulder, but in this case it wasn't really an invasion of privacy: Ruby was just curious about this strange new 'artifact', the same as she was.

"You think it's like that one book?" asked Ruby. "You know, the one about the boy who's raised by anteaters? What's it called?"

"The Rainforest Saga" said Blake. "No, I don't think so... but let's see for ourselves." She noted the page listing and flipped to it.

"Uhm...that's...interesting," said Ruby. Her statement referred to the fact that the page where the story was supposed to start didn't look like a page at all. Instead, what greeted them was a small rectangle of shimmering blackness, like the surface of an unknown liquid.

Blake's mind worked quickly, but not quickly enough. This must be why it was in that cache, she had just enough time to think, before the blackness burst its bounds and surged to envelop them both. Yang and Weiss, who hadn't even been paying attention, could scarcely react before it swallowed them too. Were anyone still in the room at that point, they would have seen the inky substance swirl around the room a few times before retreating back into the book, somewhat like water going down a drain.

The room was empty. The book was occupied.

In the Jungle...
11533213132.title: Go Wild!

115332131321.content:
Blake came to. She hadn't realized she'd been unconscious. What on earth...? she thought, but said nothing out loud. Instead, she took stock of her environment. All around her was green - lush vegetation running the gamut from ferns low on the ground to towering trees overhead and vines hanging thickly from their branches. The air was warm, and full of animal sounds. A couple butterflies fluttered around the immediate vicinity. Clearly a jungle somewhere in the world - just like the story's title.

Blake was on all fours, but something was wrong. On all fours, but it didn't feel like she was on hands and knees. Something felt very strange with her body. She looked down at her hands. Except she didn't have hands. Instead, two black paws greeted her. She tried to move her fingers and the paws flexed in response.

"Holy shit," she breathed.

Blake looked behind her to see what she'd already guessed would be there: the sleek body of a black panther. There were the back paws - her back paws. And there was the tail - her tail. Finding the muscles to move it was effortless - as if she'd always had one - and she flicked it a couple times. Of course I'd be a big black cat, she thought, with a note of bitter irony. Now I have a body to match my ears. Her ears twitched at the thought, like they'd heard her mention them. Wait, is this really what I'm thinking about right now?

Blake took a moment to collect herself and reflect. She was sure she knew what had happened, although she wasn't sure how it had happened or why. I'm inside the book, inside the story. The story was 'The Lives of The Jungle Beasts' and now I'm a jungle beast. So, what happens next?

"Ruby is probably here, too," she said out loud (hearing herself say it was reassuring), "and maybe Yang and Weiss as well. First things first, I need to find them."

I wonder what animals they are, she thought.


Who does she run into first?
115332131321.title: Blake finds herself with an animal's body.

1153321313213.content:
Blake prowled the jungle with all the grace of the cat she now was. The way her new body moved definitely felt strange, nevertheless it came to her naturally. No doubt whatever force had transformed her had some built-in feature that saw to that; otherwise she'd have had to learn to walk all over again. But that was how things usually worked in stories where people transformed - no thought for all the technical minutia, except for maybe the barest handwave. Blake had never questioned it, until suddenly finding herself in just such a story. But anyway, there were more important things to worry about right now.

"Ruby?" Blake called out. "Are you out there?" She wasn't 100% certain, but she felt pretty confident it hadn't just been her who had ended up here. "Weiss? Yang?"

A sound of crashing vegetation suddenly broke into Blake's awareness from somewhere to the left. Something large was approaching. "Who's there?" shouted Blake, feeling the fur on her back stand up. Ruby, is that you??"

A moment later the source of the noise came into view. "No, it's me," came a familiar voice, and Blake felt a wash of relief at the sight of her best friend Yang's face. Problem was, that face was attached to the body of a huge brown bear.

"Yang! You, um... you've...changed!"

"So have you!" replied Yang, wide-eyed. "Are you a panther?"

"Yes! I mean, I think -- But your head! It's still the same!"

"You too!"

"Huh?" That hadn't actually occurred to Blake, who hadn't been able to see her own face. But it made sense, didn't it? She hadn't questioned why she could still speak in her own voice - talking animals were a dime a dozen in stories, after all - but that would explain it. And sure enough, there were definitely locks of her black hair hanging down at the edges of her vision. Panthers don't have manes, right? Blake touched her face to confirm - gingerly, since she now had paws instead of hands. "Wow, you're right! Why do we still have our own faces?"

"Well, I'm always happy to see your face. It's a very pretty one." Yang smiled warmly at her friend.

Blake answered with a soft smile of her own, and a blush that was more visible than she realized. "I'm glad to see you too," she said. "And if we're both here, Ruby and Weiss must be here somewhere, too. We should look for them."

"Right." Yang nodded. "So...where is 'here?' Like, what's going on? Please tell me you know something."

"I'll fill you in while we look," said Blake.
1153321313213.title: Yang

11533213132131.content:
"...So we're inside that book? You opened it and it sucked us all in?"

"Yes - at least, I don't see any other explanation. The story I was about to read was about animals in the jungle, and now here we are."

"Wow, that's what I call a wild story!"

"Well, I'm glad you can still make jokes."

The two girls-turned-animals walked side by side through the sweltering forest. Blake stepped nimbly, weaving between trees with scarcely a trace of her passage, while Yang simply powered through any obstacles she couldn't avoid.

"So you think Ruby and Weiss are here too?" asked Yang, stepping through some protruding roots as gingerly as she could in light of the bear's body she was now controlling.

"I'm sure of it."

"You think they might be animals, too?"

"Probably."

"What kind?"

"No idea."

"Well I'm gonna be extra careful where I step, just in case they're bugs or mice or something."

Blake didn't think that was something to worry about, though admittedly she did take an extra-good look before taking her next step.

Neither of them would need to worry long, as it turned out, because the next member of their group had just found them herself.

"Yang! Blake! I found you guys!" It was Ruby's voice that rang out from the trees. Blake and Yang froze, looking around for her location.

"Up here!" called Ruby. There were sounds of leaves rustling and branches shaking somewhere overhead, but before Blake could pinpoint a source something dropped down on them. A black hairy creature the approximate size of a cat was now clambering all over Yang, and it took a moment before Blake could clearly see the face of their team leader, Ruby Rose, on the body of a monkey with long black fur.

"Aaaaaah!! I'm so happy to see you guys!" Ruby gushed, still in frenetic motion. "Blake! You're a panther! And Yang! You're a bear! So cool!!" She jumped from her sister's back to the trunk of an adjacent tree and then ran along one of its lower branches, seemingly unable to stop moving for a second.

"...You seem weirdly happy with this," was all Blake could say.

"I know, I should probably be worried," Ruby replied, "but this is all so crazy and cool! We must've gotten sucked into that jungle story, and yeah I'm not sure how we're gonna get out, but right now it's SO EXCITING!!!"

"Calm down for a second," said Blake. "Have you seen --"

"Well, I guess we're all here then." This new voice came from somewhere down low. Blake's paw had been touching something on the ground she had thought was a vine, only now the vine moved. Looking down, she saw that the 'vine' was actually a white, scaly tail, which slipped away from her foot and under a bush. Attempting to follow its path, she found the tail belonged to a snake, bright white and frighteningly long, the other end of which was hidden in a clump of grass. Then, from the grass rose the head of their final teammate, Weiss Schnee. Weiss was now an enormous serpent.

"Weiss?" said Yang. "Is that really you?"

"Weiss is here??" cried Ruby, who at the moment was too high up in the tree to have seen. "Let me see!" A couple leaps and bounds brought her to the forest floor, where she stood face-to-face with the snake that sported her friend's head. "Ohmigosh," she said quietly, "Weiss...you're so pretty!"

Weiss's face flushed red and it took her a second to reply. "So...you're a monkey, huh? ...I like it. It suits you." Blake wasn't sure if that was intended as an insult or not. With Weiss you couldn't always tell.

"Anyway," said the heiress-turned-reptile, "can anyone tell me what the hell is going on??"

Ruby spoke before Blake could. "We got sucked into that book from the artifact cache and now we're in a story about jungle animals...um, probably."

"That's about the size of it," confirmed Blake. "I'm not sure what to do next, but we should definitely stick together."

"Hmm." said Weiss, curtly. "I'm not happy about any of this, but you're right. We work best together, and who knows how dangerous this place might be." A beat later, a skinny forked tongue flickered out from between her lips and then quickly flitted back in.

Ruby and Yang were both staring at her the way one might stare at a kitten that had just made a tiny sneeze. "THAT WAS SO CUTE!" They both said in unison.

"Sh-shut up!" Weiss retorted. "Nothing about this is cute! What's the matter with you people?!?"

"Guys, I think we'd better decide on our next move soon," said Blake, looking at the sky through the canopy overhead, "because I think a storm might be coming."
11533213132131.title: Ruby is next

13321.content: OK, so there's quite a few ladies to choose from. Let's start with two favorites:
13321.title: Overwatch

133211.content:
Lena Oxton surveyed the facility from the hill above it. She'd spent a whole week skulking around the perimeter, always at a reasonable distance of course, determining the safest angle of approach. After finding it, she had waited until the optimal moment before daring to get close. Now the time had come to make her move.

There were plenty of rumors surrounding the site, and the lack of official information about it only made things worse. Nobody could say exactly what it was that was being done there - not even some inane cover story had been put forward. Add to that a couple of sightings of mysterious figures strongly resembling Talon operatives, and Lena - "Tracer" as her Overwatch colleagues had once called her - decided to get involved. She had no intention of actually doing anything once she made it inside - tonight was for reconnaissance purposes only. Sneak in, see what was going on, sneak back out. Any longer and she'd be sure to catch hell from Emily when she returned. She was probably due for a chewing out as it was.

Lena approached the building undetected (as she had anticipated) and hoisted herself through a window. Inside most lights were off, and all was quiet - actually, no: all was not quiet. As Lena listened she could hear a peculiar hum coming from somewhere deeper in the building. Find whatever's making that noise and I'll find the answers, she thought to herself.

Lena was the picture of stealth as she crept along the corridors, yet perhaps it was not necessary, as she saw no sign of anyone else in the building. Well, that wasn't going to get her to let her guard down. It would be naive to assume that there would be no security, especially if Talon was really involved. Fortunately she had all the equipment she needed with her: her two pulse guns sat snug in their holsters - even though she was intending to avoid trouble, it was always good to have insurance - and the chronal accelerator strapped to her chest was still warm in standby mode. If she did run into trouble, it would be instrumental in ensuring her escape.

At the point where the hum grew loudest, Lena found herself facing a large door. She tried the handle carefully - unlocked, miraculously. Very, very slowly she turned the handle all the way and eased the door open just a crack. Light spilled out from the other side, but the door wasn't open enough to see anything. She teased the door open a little further until there was a crack she could put her eye to. From what she could see, the room was large, brightly lit, and empty of people. It was split into multiple levels, with stairs and catwalks above. There was some scattered machinery, but although the noise was clearly coming from inside the room, she couldn't see what was making it. She pushed the door open further and slipped inside.

Fully inside the room, she could finally see the source of the hum. In the center of the room (out of sight from the cracked-open door) stood an enormous device of uncertain purpose. It took up most of the floorspace, and stretched all the way to the ceiling. In addition to the hum, it gave off a distinct whitish glow. Surrounding it were all manner of terminals, energy-measuring devices, and other equipment Lena couldn't name.

Is it some kind of power source? Lena wondered as she approached it. Why would they leave it on when no one's around? She poked around the various terminals, some with computers and others with more esoteric consoles. She supposed she might be able to access one of the computers to see what kind of information was on it, but she didn't want to fiddle with anything else. It would also take time, and Lena still wasn't sure she was alone. She walked around the huge machine to see what might be on the other side of it. Beyond the machine, in addition to more consoles and computers, the room stretched on a short ways to a doorless, windowless wall. Along the wall, at several elevations, were more catwalks. And on one of the catwalks...

Lena's instincts took hold while her conscious mind was still processing. Instantly she leapt backward, just as a bullet embedded itself in the floor where she had been standing. She ducked behind some obscuring machinery and quickly switched on the accelerator. The huge machine in the center of the room made a curious noise as the accelerator came on, but she had other things to worry about at the moment.

"You really shouldn't have come here, cherie." The voice was a woman's, silky, with a French accent. Lena knew that voice, even though she'd only heard it once before. "But, surely you couldn't resist. Always the hero, no?"

Lena said nothing, but drew her pulse guns. As she did so, an arc of electricity jumped from her accelerator to the panel she was hiding behind. Shit! She thought. Bloody thing better not be thinking about acting up now...

The woman on the catwalk spoke again. "They saw you poking around here a few days ago. Did you really think you were being so discreet? Of course, they called me in to deal with you. I must say, I was excited to see you again... Our last encounter ended so poorly, after all."

"I'm glad you remember me!" Lena called out from her hiding place. "Who were you again?" No response. Right. Now or never, then. Lena rolled out from behind her cover, both guns blasting the spot where her opponent had just been standing. But her opponent was no longer there. Instantly shifting into a crouch, Lena caught a blur of movement overhead, then stood up and pirouetted just in time to catch the figure landing behind her. She fired off another shot, but the figure deftly jumped aside.

In what seemed like several seconds, but was likely less than one, Lena's eyes took in the sight before her. It was a woman, very slim, in a form-fitting purplish catsuit, which was likely reinforced with armor fibers. She wore black gloves and boots that seemed to be made of a heavier substance than her bodysuit, and on top of her head was a segmented headset featuring multiple lenses, giving the impression of a spider's eyes. Behind the headset, her dark hair was tied back in one of the longest ponytails Lena had seen. Her face itself was fair-featured, lovely even, but there was no sign of warmth or tenderness in her expression. She was quite beautiful, actually, apart from the coldness in her eyes, but the one thing about her that stood out the most was the fact that her skin was a brilliant blue. Lena remembered the last time she had seen this person...the night Mondatta had died. There was no way she was ever going to forget her. This was the Talon assassin known as "Widowmaker".

More arcs of electricity suddenly sparked from the accelerator. Crap, not now, not now. Lena wasn't moving, but Widowmaker hadn't fired, either.

"I'm under orders not to damage the equipment too much," said Widowmaker, smiling cruelly. "So, could you please step away from that machinery just a bit?"

Lena glanced to her side. The nearest cover was nearly 30 feet away, behind the machine itself. There was no way she could make it at a normal speed, not with a gun already trained on her, but if she used the accelerator... the question was, would it work properly?

"Right, right, of course," she said in response to the assassin's request. "Just a tick." Then, without warning, she let off two blasts from her pulse guns and made a break for it, her accelerator humming to life. Electricity shot from the accelerator in multiple arcs. The glow from the huge device intensified, and the hum became a loud whine. "Qu'est-ce que c'est?" yelled Widowmaker behind her. Lena knew that she was still running, but it seemed as if time had slowed down. Now the huge device was emitting electricity of its own, and the bolts from the accelerator met the bolts from the machine, dancing between the two objects like a Van de Graaf generator.

"That...may have been a mistake," said Lena as white light enveloped her and overwhelmed her senses.

What Happens Next?
133211.title: Tracer (Lena Oxton)
